radiographic_examinations.findings: The lung bases are clear without pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver is normal in appearance. The portal veins are patent. The gallbladder is unremarkable. The pancreas appears normal. The spleen is normal in appearance. The adrenals appear normal bilaterally. The kidneys demonstrate symmetric contrast enhancement and brisk bilateral excretion. Incidental note is made of a cyst in the left mid pole. A lap band is appropriately positioned, without complications. The stomach is distended with positive contrast and appears normal. Visualized loops of small bowel are normal in caliber and enhancement. There is no intraperitoneal free fluid or free air. The aorta is normal in caliber along its visualized course. There is no pathologic retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. In the right lower quadrant there is a dilated appendix measuring up to 9 cm, with surrounding fat stranding. There is no appendicolith. There is no evidence of perforation. The remainder of the colon appears normal. The bladder is distended and unremarkable. Incidental note is made of a right adnexal cyst measuring 2.4 cm. The uterus is normal in appearance. There is no pelvic side wall lymphadenopathy. There is no concerning lytic or blastic osseous lesion.
